SRAI

Dr. Sunny Rai is Asst. Prosessor in NLP, Metaphor processing & Data Science

Home Search About

About

Dr. Sunny Rai, School of Engineering Sciences, Mahindra Ecole Centrale

Dr. Sunny Rai is Asst. Professor in Computer Science & Engineering Department at Mahindra University (Formerly École Centrale School of Engineering). She has done Ph.D. in Computer Engineering from Netaji Subhas Institute of Technology, Delhi University. Her thesis top was Computational Metaphor Processing in English Language. She has over 5 years of academic teaching experience and is actively engaged in research in the field of NLP, Computational Metaphor processing, Linguistics, Social Computing

Research

Journals (chronological order):

  1. Rai, Sunny & Shampa Chakraverty, A Survey on Computational Metaphor Processing. Vol 53, Issue 2, ACM Computing Surveys. March 2020. http://dx.doi.org/10.1145/3373265
  2. Rai, Sunny, Chakraverty, Shampa, Tayal, Devendra. K., Sharma, D., & Garg, A. (2019). Understanding Metaphors Using Emotions. New Generation Computing, 37(1), 5-27. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00354-018-0045-3
  3. Rai, Sunny, Shampa Chakraverty, Devendra K. Tayal, and Yash Kukreti. (2018). ”A Study on Impact of Context on Metaphor Detection.” The Computer Journal 61, no. 11 (2018): 1667-1682. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/bxy032
  4. Jain, Amita, Devendra K. Tayal, and Sunny Rai. (2015) “Shrinking digital gap through automatic generation of WordNet for Indian languages.” AI & SOCIETY 30, no. 2 (2015): 215-222, Springer. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00146-014-0548-5

Conferences (chronological order):

  1. Uma Maheswari Gollapudi, Rahul Arulkumaran, Manikumar Perla, Sai Hitesh Jonnala- gadda, Amitava Das and Sunny Rai. “Understanding User Vulnerability Towards Radicalization On Twitter”. In 5th International Conference on Computational Social Science. The Netherlands. 2019.
  2. Rai Sunny and Apar Garg, “Understanding the role of visual features in Emoji Similarity”, In Third International Conference on Intelligent Information Technologies, India. pp. 89-97. Springer, Singapore, 2018. DOI: https://doi.org/10.1007/978-981-13-3582-2_7
  3. Rai Sunny, Shampa Chakraverty. (2017) “Metaphor Detection Using Fuzzy Rough Sets.” In: Polkowski L. et al. (eds) Rough Sets. International Joint Conference on Rough Sets (IJCRS) 2017. Olysztyn, Poland. Lecture Notes in Computer Science, vol 10313. Springer, Cham. DOI: https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-319-60837-2_23
  4. Rai, Sunny, Shampa Chakraverty, and Devendra K. Tayal. (2016). “Supervised metaphor detection using conditional random fields.” In Proceedings of the Fourth Workshop on Metaphor in NLP, NAACL-HLT, San Diego, USA. pp. 18-27. Association of Computational Linguistics. DOI: https://doi.org/10.18653/v1/w16-1103
